Most Illustrious Sir

On this date, the government ordered Citizen Colonel Pedro Vieira to promote, besides Camaquã, a gathering of all men capable of bearing arms, with the purpose of placing them at the point he deems most appropriate, not only to observe the movements of the enemy, but also to pursue and defeat any group that, during the absence of the Left Division, dares to set foot on our territory; consequently to Your Lordship

God keep Your Lordship Secretariat of War Affairs in Caçapava, 1st of April, 1840. Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre

Most Illustrious Sir Inácio José de Oliveira Guimarães. Official letter from the Minister of War Serafim Joaquim de Alencastre dated 1st of April, received on the 9th of the same month, ordering the gathering of the department and making it march under the orders of Colonel Vieira.
